title: What are some pop songs with amazing bridge sections? - Quora

response.answer_text: The lack of good answers here is just saddening. Depending on your definition of “pop” and “bridge” here’s a quick list for you… Jewel - You were meant for meFoo Fighters - Learn to FlyCage the Elephant - Shake me DownKate Bush (but I like the Within Temptation or Placebo versions better) - Running up that HillStevie Nicks - Edge of SeventeenFuel - ShimmerRHCP - I could have lied RHCP - DosedMetallica - The Memory Remains (Normally they opt for a good ol’ guitar solo but this little jem has Marianne Faithful singing on it)Matthew Good - Strange DaysFlorence and the Machine - The Drumming song (so many parts could be debated which part you would call a bridge) but awesome all the way throughMuse - Dead INside (those vocals are chilling)Staind - It’s Been a While Rise Against - Satellite (will never get tired of this one “We’ll sneak out, while they sleep, and sail off in the night”)Moist - Resurrection (Great Canadian band check them out) That should get you started. Best in love, Andrew

One of my favorite albums of the last ten years is Miguel’s Kaleidoscope Dream. 2012 as a strong year for R&B, and this album was my favorite of the bunch. Of the many things I like about Kaleidoscope Dream, Miguel has a real knack for song structure. Every song is well written and well paced, and quite a few have great bridge sections. While I’m fond of the bridges in “Don’t Look Back” and “The Thrill,” the example I present here is “Adorn,” his hit single that earned three Grammy nominations, including Song of the Year. As he does on many of his songs, he uses the brief bridge to set up a big vocal climax in the final verse, and he nails it here.
